::: {.cell}

### Version history

This page provides information about older or alternative versions of  indicative distribution map for this ecosystem functional group [**{{< meta params.efgname >}}**](/efg-info/T5_5.qmd).
Check the current maps [here](/map-info/T5_5_valid.qmd).

- Indicative Map (**code: T5.5.IM.alt**, version v2.0) replaced 
 - Indicative Map (**code: T5.5.IM.orig**, version v1.0) discarded 
 - Web navigation (**code: T5.5.web.orig**, version v1.0) requires review 
 - Web navigation (**code: T5.5.WM.nwx**, version v1.0) in preparation 

### Datasets

Datasets considered for previous versions of the indicative map

- **CRU-TS-v4** (Harris et al. 2014).
 - **Global-AI-PET-v2** (Trabucco and Zomer 2019).
 - **Resolve-Ecoregions-2017** (Dinerstein et al. 2017).
 - **TerraClimate-2018** (Abatzoglou et al. 2018).
 - **WAD-2018** (Cherlet et al. 2018).
 - **NA** (UNEP 1992).

::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}


|dataset                 |url                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
|:-----------------------|:-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|CRU-TS-v4               |<https://crudata.uea.ac.uk/cru/data/hrg/>{target='links'}                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|Global-AI-PET-v2        |<https://csidotinfo.wordpress.com/2019/01/24/global-aridity-index-and-potential-evapotranspiration-climate-database-v3/>{target='links'} :: <https://cgiarcsi.community/2019/01/24/global-aridity-index-and-potential-evapotranspiration-climate-database-v2/>{target='links'} :: <http://www.cgiar-csi.org/wp-content/uploads/2012/11/Global-Aridity-and-Global-PET-Methodology.pdf>{target='links'} |
|Resolve-Ecoregions-2017 |<https://ecoregions2017.appspot.com/>{target='links'} :: <https://geospatial.tnc.org/datasets/7b7fb9d945544d41b3e7a91494c42930_0>{target='links'}                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
|TerraClimate-2018       |<http://www.climatologylab.org/terraclimate.html>{target='links'}                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
|WAD-2018                |<https://wad.jrc.ec.europa.eu/download>{target='links'} :: <https://wad.jrc.ec.europa.eu/>{target='links'}                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |


:::
:::

### Available files

You can download geospatial data for older versions of these maps from the following sources:

**T5.5.IM.orig** (v1.0): [Zenodo repository (EFG map)](http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.3958622){target="gisdata"}

**T5.5.web.orig** (v1.0): [GitHub repository](https://github.com/red-list-ecosystem/typology-map-data/blob/master/data/layers/T5.5.web.orig_topo.json){target="gisdata"}

Note that you need to login to some services like [mapbox](https://www.mapbox.com){target="links"} or [earthengine](https://earthengine.google.com){target="links"}, and in some cases you also need to request access to the files.

###  License information

Indicative maps have been released with a ![](https://zenodo.org/static/icons/licenses/cc-by-icon.svg){height=20} Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International license. 

But see details of dataset licenses below:

::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}

|:-----------------------|:-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|

|Global-AI-PET-v2        |http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/ :: Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License                                                                                     |
|Resolve-Ecoregions-2017 |https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/                                                                                                                                              |

## References

References used in these versions of the maps.

- Cherlet, M., Hutchinson, C., Reynolds, J., Hill, J., Sommer, S., von Maltitz, G. (2018) **World Atlas of Desertification** Publication Office of the European Union, Luxembourg. 
 - Abatzoglou, J.T., S.Z. Dobrowski, S.A. Parks, K.C. Hegewisch (2018) *Terraclimate, a high-resolution global dataset of monthly climate and climatic water balance from 1958-2015* **Scientific Data** 5, 170191 [DOI:10.1038/sdata.2017.191](http:dx.doi.org/10.1038/sdata.2017.191) 
 - NA 
 - Trabucco, Antonio; Zomer, Robert (2019) *Global Aridity Index and Potential Evapotranspiration (ET0) Climate Database v2* **figshare** Fileset [DOI:10.6084/m9.figshare.7504448.v3](http:dx.doi.org/10.6084/m9.figshare.7504448.v3) 
 - Dinerstein E, Olson D, Joshi A, Vynne C, Burgess ND, Wikramanayake E, Hahn N, Palminteri S, Hedao P, Noss R, Hansen M, Locke H, Ellis EE, Jones B, Barber CV, Hayes R, Kormos C, Martin V, Crist E, Sechrest W, Price L, Baillie JEM, Weeden D, Suckling K, Davis C, Sizer N, Moore R, Thau D, Birch T, Potapov P, Turubanova S, Tyukavina A, de Souza N, Pintea L, Brito JC, Llewellyn Barnekow Lillesø JP, van Breugel P, Graudal L, Voge M, Al-Shammari KF, Saleem M (2017) *An Ecoregion-Based Approach to Protecting Half the Terrestrial Realm*, **BioScience** 67: 534–545. DOI:[10.1093/biosci/bix014](https://doi.org/10.1093/biosci/bix014). [Data-set available on-line](https://ecoregions2017.appspot.com/) 
 - Harris, I., Jones, P.D., Osborn, T.J. and Lister, D.H. (2014), *Updated high-resolution grids of monthly climatic observations - the CRU TS3.10 Dataset*. **International Journal of Climatology** 34, 623-642 [doi:10.1002/joc.3711](http://dx.doi.org/10.1002/joc.3711) [Revised appendix](https://crudata.uea.ac.uk/cru/data/hrg/Revised_Appendix_3_CLD.pdf)
